pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:0.5: 46. The training rule on giving food
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā was personally giving food to actors, dancers, acrobats, magicians, and musicians, saying,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.5: “Venerable Thullanandā is a learned reciter; she’s confident and skilled at giving teachings.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.6: Give to her; work for her!”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.7: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.8: “How can Venerable Thullanandā personally give food to householders?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.9: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā does this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.12: “… How can the nun Thullanandā do this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.13: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.14: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.15.1: ‘If a nun personally gives staple or non-staple food to a householder or a male wanderer or a female wanderer, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.8: any male wanderer apart from Buddhist monks and novice monks.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.10: any female wanderer apart from Buddhist nuns, trainee nuns, and novice nuns.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.12: apart from the five staple foods
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.13: and water and tooth cleaners, the rest is called “non-staple food”.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.15: there are five kinds of staple food: cooked grain, porridge, flour, fish, and meat.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.17: if she gives by body or by what is connected to the body or by releasing, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.18: If she gives water or tooth cleaners, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.2.2: if she does not give, but has it given;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.2.3: if she gives by placing it near the person;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.2.4: if she gives ointments for external use;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.2.6: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.2.7: The sixth training rule is finished.
